item.title: "help" on navbar
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I don’t see any real position on this topic. You’re mostly asking to remove the button, because you accidentally click it.
But if you remove said button, like Phaze said, you’d just click the next one down.

[hr]
As for the poll:

“Don’t know” shouldn’t be an option, as that’s equivalent to not caring. If you don’t know about something, in this case, then you don’t have a suggestion to make it better, or remove it.

“Make it a “Helpful link page”” - To consider this idea, albeit it isn’t half bad, you need to show what you mean by it. Make a mock-up if you will. but merely suggesting it won’t get anywhere.

“Just remove it!” as said before, you need a liable reason on why to remove it, removal wouldn’t actually solve any problem.

“Make home go to moparisthebest.com, and make help be forum and go to the index” - This could be worded better, ex: “Change the nav bar to make “Home” go to the site home, and change “Help” to “Forums” and make it go to the forum home”
While I don’t see a true issue behind this. Older users would get irritated, and annoyed until they stopped clicking “Home” because it no longer took them to what they expect, the forums.

“Babymaking???” - Very immature to actually even add this. It makes your post, and suggestion, seem worthless, and that you don’t have a real cause behind it.

“No/Pointless” - By far the only real, and accurate option on this poll. Because 10 to 1, all users will understand how to say no.

[quote=“Phaze One, post:11, topic:523186”]Yes you’re right, it should definitely be removed so members can accidentally click on search instead. Now actual suggestions I thought about this yesterday some:

-Make “home” go to the actual “homepage”
-Make the “help” button actually say “Forum” this would take you directly to the index instead

^ probably the best thought I had for it.

Other options:

-make the help section itself cover syntax, bbc(go into large detail cause a lot of topics people don’t use bbc/or use it incorrectly!)

-turn the help section into a “generic link help page” This page would have links to various well clicked topics such as “common server help questions, mopar monthly, irl pictures thread, and etc”

-Turn the help button to be an actual “help” center. For a long time I have felt liked that we are almost as bad as jagex forum wise. Only a few topics really and truly get actual interaction from the staff/the server helpers. There should be like a help live chat thing or something like that maybe? (don’t really like the idea myself but not sure what else could be used for )
